articles.title: Chinese residents in quarantine call for government action
articles.description: Some communities are taking matters into their hands to deal with the coronavirus epidemic.
articles.content:
The Chinese government has announced that it will charter flights to bring its citizens from Wuhan stranded overseas back to China. This comes as the pace of international evacuations from Wuhan picks up.

articles.title: UK confirms first two coronavirus cases
articles.description: Two members of the same family tested positive for coronavirus, Chris Whitty, chief medical officer for England, says.
articles.content:
Two cases of coronavirus have been confirmed in the United Kingdom, the first such cases seen, British health authorities said on Friday.

articles.title: How does coronavirus spread and how can you protect yourself?
articles.description: The 2019-nCoV coronavirus spreads from person-to-person in close proximity, similarly to other respiratory illnesses.
articles.content:
Almost 10,000 people have been infected by the new coronavirus, which continues to spread to more countries since it was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan in early December.

articles.author: Shawn Yuan
articles.title: Diary of a Wuhan native: A week under coronavirus quarantine
articles.description: Teacher from epicentre of the deadly outbreak describe the growing anxiety under lockdown and anger towards government.
articles.content: At least nine million people in Wuhan were put under quarantine on January 23rd after the authorities decided to seal off the entire city. The order was later expanded to the entire Hubei province, affecting at least 56 million people. Now a week has passed. … [+7092 chars]

articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.title: Coronavirus: Pakistan not to evacuate citizens from Wuhan
articles.description: At least four Pakistani students studying in Wuhan have been infected by the virus.
articles.content:
Governments globally are grappling with the challenge of how to get their citizens out of China's Wuhan city, the epicentre of the outbreak.
But Pakistan is not evacuating anyone, leaving hundreds of foreign students in limbo.
